availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Thomas M. Woods (Trimble County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier)

body.p: Trimble County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of David Woods and Sarah Woods. Married to Elizabeth Conway in Trimble County, Kentucky, on February 17, 1859. Father of Catherine Wood. Resident of Gallatin County in 1850. Farmer in Trimble County in 1860. Farmer in 1862. Served in the 13th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a private from August 28, 1862 to 1864. Wounded at the Battle of Huff's Ferry, Roane County, Tennessee on November 14, 1863. Reported as transferred to the 6th Kentucky Veteran Cavalry Regiment (U.S.A.).

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States_ (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Gallatin County, p. 266A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Trimble County, p. 297.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers Who Served in Organizations From the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0269.
Kentucky Death Certificates, 1911-1965, Kentucky Office of Vital Statistics, KDLA, Frankfort, KY, File 25880.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Trimble County Marriages, Film 000420392.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), p. 870.
